title: Hawaii braces for severe thunderstorms, flooding starting tonight | Flipboard
text: Hawaii braces for severe thunderstorms, flooding starting tonight May 9—The National Weather Service updated a "" overnight, warning of the potential for severe thunderstorms and possible flash flooding affecting … [Sean Kernan](/@seanjkernan) flipped this story into [World and Breaking News](/@seanjkernan/world-and-breaking-news-lcevfku7z)•1h Related storyboards More stories from [Weather](/topic/weather) [Jury awards California sisters $18 million from insurance company that offered only $5,000 for storm damage](/topic/weather/jury-awards-california-sisters-18-million-from-insurance-company-that-offered-o/a-R3iyAcqYQlaGcu2eHRhDaA%3Aa%3A2034191127-bcc490ecf9%2Fmercurynews.com) A San Bernardino County jury has awarded two women $18 million after determining their insurance carrier acted in bad faith when it failed to pay out … - Storyboard Americans' biggest fears when they leave the safety of their own home Join the flipboard community Discover, collect, and share stories for all your interests [Sign up](/signup) More stories from [Hawaii](/topic/hawaii) [Special Weather Statement Issued For Hawaiʻi](/topic/hawaii/special-weather-statement-issued-for-hawai-i/f-33183aadca%2Fbigislandvideonews.com) HAWAIʻI - Forecasters say there could be very active weather across the state this weekend, with the potential to bring severe thunderstorms and … [fell for it ‘They gave me exact amounts’ Costco shopper fumes after he lost $34,000 in hours – call gave him false sense of security](/topic/hawaii/fell-for-it-they-gave-me-exact-amounts-costco-shopper-fumes-after-he-lost-34-/a-iLUnfipaTkO9m7gOb7FAVA%3Aa%3A3291032469-7a00203fb8%2Fthe-sun.com) A COSTCO shopper saw more than $30,000 drained from his account within hours after receiving a call he thought was from his bank. Dan Michalski, from … [FEMA Is Still Spending Millions On Hundreds Of Empty Housing Units For Maui Fire Survivors](/topic/hawaii/fema-is-still-spending-millions-on-hundreds-of-empty-housing-units-for-maui-fire/a-VdGdrP6MQQaxSKvsP4Aw8A%3Aa%3A3754785727-69f2e9a0a2%2Fcivilbeat.org) The agency has found available housing but is struggling to get people to move in. On Friday, it ends its support for the emergency hotel program.
